Difficulty in expressing complex ideas or technical concepts in a language that may not be understood by all team members.
Lack of common ground or shared vocabulary between team members from different cultural backgrounds, leading to tension and conflict.
Difficulty in building trust and rapport with colleagues who speak different languages, making it harder to work collaboratively.
Inability to effectively communicate with clients or customers who speak a different language, leading to misunderstandings and lost business opportunities.
Difficulty in understanding cultural nuances and norms, leading to unintentional offenses or misinterpretations.
